mvi-ldc-AFF-Index.def: Defined as the percentage share of the agriculture, hunting, forestry, and fishing sectors in the gross value added of a country
mvi-ldc-AFF-Index.name: Share of agriculture in GDP
mvi-ldc-AFF-Index.source: United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA).
mvi-ldc-AFF-Index.dataset: United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA).

mvi-ldc-AIN-Index.def: Defined as the standard deviation of the difference between agricultural production and its 20-year trend
mvi-ldc-AIN-Index.name: Instability of agricultural production
mvi-ldc-AIN-Index.source: CDP Secretariat, based on agricultural production data from FAO, FAOSTAT
mvi-ldc-AIN-Index.dataset: CDP Secretariat, based on agricultural production data from FAO, FAOSTAT

mvi-ldc-DRY-Index.def: Defined as the percentage of population that lives in drylands, defined by long term averages of the ratio of precipitation to potential evapotranspiration (known as aridity index)
mvi-ldc-DRY-Index.name: Share of population living in drylands
mvi-ldc-DRY-Index.source: CDP Secretariat, based on an aridity index derived from high resolution climate data from University of East Anglia Climatic Research Unit (CRU TS version 4) and gridded population data from Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University
mvi-ldc-DRY-Index.dataset: CDP Secretariat, based on an aridity index derived from high resolution climate data from University of East Anglia Climatic Research Unit (CRU TS version 4) and gridded population data from Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University

mvi-ldc-LECZ-Index.def: Population below 5m is the percentage of the total population living in areas where the elevation is 5 meters or less.
mvi-ldc-LECZ-Index.name: Share of population in low elevated coast zone
mvi-ldc-LECZ-Index.source: Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University and CUNY Institute for Demographic Research (CIDR), City University of New York. 2020. Low Elevation Coastal Zone (LECZ) Urban-Rural Population and Land Area Estimates, Version 3 Preliminary Release. Palisades, NY: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC). Accessed 30 July 2020. For a number of small island and coastal States, data are from CIESIN, Population, Landscape, And Climate Estimates, Version 3 (PLACE III)
mvi-ldc-LECZ-Index.dataset: Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University and CUNY Institute for Demographic Research (CIDR), City University of New York. 2020. Low Elevation Coastal Zone (LECZ) Urban-Rural Population and Land Area Estimates, Version 3 Preliminary Release. Palisades, NY: NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC). Accessed 30 July 2020. For a number of small island and coastal States, data are from CIESIN, Population, Landscape, And Climate Estimates, Version 3 (PLACE III)

mvi-ldc-REM-Index.def: Defined as a trade-weighted average of a country's distance from world markets
mvi-ldc-REM-Index.name: Remoteness
mvi-ldc-REM-Index.source: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA) and distance data from Centre d'Etudes Prospectives et d'Informations Internationales
mvi-ldc-REM-Index.dataset: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA) and distance data from Centre d'Etudes Prospectives et d'Informations Internationales

mvi-ldc-VIC-Index.def: Measures the share of population who are victims of disasters, defined as people killed or affected (i.e. requiring immediate food, water, shelter, sanitation, or medical assistance)
mvi-ldc-VIC-Index.name: Victims of disasters
mvi-ldc-VIC-Index.source: CDP Secretariat, based on disaster data from the OFDA/CRED International Disaster Database and population data from United Nations Population Division, World Population Prospects (WPP) 2019 Revision
mvi-ldc-VIC-Index.dataset: CDP Secretariat, based on disaster data from the OFDA/CRED International Disaster Database and population data from United Nations Population Division, World Population Prospects (WPP) 2019 Revision

mvi-ldc-XCON-Index.def: Provides information on the exposure to trade shocks resulting from a concentrated export structure. Measures the product concentration of a country's exports
mvi-ldc-XCON-Index.name: Export concentration
mvi-ldc-XCON-Index.source: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)
mvi-ldc-XCON-Index.dataset: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)

mvi-ldc-XIN-Index.def: The standard deivation of the difference between the value of annual export earnings and its 20-year trend
mvi-ldc-XIN-Index.name: Instability of exports of goods and services
mvi-ldc-XIN-Index.source: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services and trade dependency (ratio of exports plus imports to GDP) from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA)
mvi-ldc-XIN-Index.dataset: CDP Secretariat, based on data for exports and imports and goods and services and trade dependency (ratio of exports plus imports to GDP) from United Nations Statistics Division National Accounts Main Aggregates Database (AMA)

mvi-wdi-BX.KLT.DINV.WD.GD.ZS.def: Foreign direct investment are the net inflows of investment to acquire a lasting management interest (10 percent or more of voting stock) in an enterprise operating in an economy other than that of the investor. It is the sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other long-term capital, and short-term capital as shown in the balance of payments. This series shows net inflows (new investment inflows less disinvestment) in the reporting economy from foreign investors, and is divided by GDP.
mvi-wdi-BX.KLT.DINV.WD.GD.ZS.name: Foreign direct investment: net inflows (% of GDP)
mvi-wdi-BX.KLT.DINV.WD.GD.ZS.source: International Monetary Fund, International Financial Statistics and Balance of Payments databases, World Bank, International Debt Statistics, and World Bank and OECD GDP estimates.
mvi-wdi-BX.KLT.DINV.WD.GD.ZS.dataset: International Monetary Fund, International Financial Statistics and Balance of Payments databases, World Bank, International Debt Statistics, and World Bank and OECD GDP estimates.

mvi-wdi-BX.TRF.PWKR.DT.GD.ZS.def: Personal remittances comprise personal transfers and compensation of employees. Personal transfers consist of all current transfers in cash or in kind made or received by resident households to or from nonresident households. Personal transfers thus include all current transfers between resident and nonresident individuals. Compensation of employees refers to the income of border, seasonal, and other short-term workers who are employed in an economy where they are not resident and of residents employed by nonresident entities. Data are the sum of two items defined in the sixth edition of the IMF's Balance of Payments Manual: personal transfers and compensation of employees.
mvi-wdi-BX.TRF.PWKR.DT.GD.ZS.name: Personal remittances:  received (% of GDP)
mvi-wdi-BX.TRF.PWKR.DT.GD.ZS.source: World Bank staff estimates based on IMF balance of payments data, and World Bank and OECD GDP estimates.
mvi-wdi-BX.TRF.PWKR.DT.GD.ZS.dataset: World Bank staff estimates based on IMF balance of payments data, and World Bank and OECD GDP estimates.

mvi-wdi2-ST.INT.RCPT.XP.ZS.def: International tourism receipts are expenditures by international inbound visitors, including payments to national carriers for international transport. These receipts include any other prepayment made for goods or services received in the destination country. They also may include receipts from same-day visitors, except when these are important enough to justify separate classification. For some countries they do not include receipts for passenger transport items. Their share in exports is calculated as a ratio to exports of goods and services, which comprise all transactions between residents of a country and the rest of the world involving a change of ownership from residents to nonresidents of general merchandise, goods sent for processing and repairs, nonmonetary gold, and services.
mvi-wdi2-ST.INT.RCPT.XP.ZS.name: International tourism: receipts (% of total exports)
mvi-wdi2-ST.INT.RCPT.XP.ZS.source: World Tourism Organization, Yearbook of Tourism Statistics, Compendium of Tourism Statistics and data files, and IMF and World Bank exports estimates.
mvi-wdi2-ST.INT.RCPT.XP.ZS.dataset: World Tourism Organization, Yearbook of Tourism Statistics, Compendium of Tourism Statistics and data files, and IMF and World Bank exports estimates.
